metadata.title: CVE-2012-5339 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 3.5.xbefore 3.5.3 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary webscript or HTML via a crafted name of (1) an event, (2) a procedure, or (3)a trigger.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:3.5.8.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:3.5.8.1-1').
